reviewText: The period from the late forties to the early sixties was a golden age of Hollywood westerns, and FROM HELL TO TEXAS is one of the true classics from that period.  It's not well known because Don Murray is not one of the big stars of that period.  But it is well written, photographed and directed (by Henry Hathaway) and features a great supporting cast, including Chill Wills, R.G. Armstrong, John Larch, Dennis Hopper and Jay C. Flippen.  And now it's available from Koch in Germany as an anamorphic widescreen release.  Don't miss this one.
Very pleased with the service and the quality of the movie. One of the classic westerns! Glad to have it in my library.
Have not seen this movie in years.  It seems to have dropped off the face of the Earth.  It never airs even on TCM.  Too bad it really works on lots of levels.  I would love to get a DVD.
Great acting & dialogue. Good crisp clarity. No animation, a big plus.
Veteran director Henry Hathaway's seldom seen western with Don Murray, Chill Wills and Diana Varsi is an off-beat but thoroughly enjoyable treat.  Don't miss it.

Great western good see Don Murray in the leading role out prove his innonence
for something that was not fault All the other actors played a good part in this western
well worth watching.
Beautiful film, a type of film that would not be produced or shown in today's crazy world of sex, vulgarity, and violence.
